comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 26105073@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/10659106@N00] Outstanding work, Holmes. You've reminded me that you must first examine the photo very closely.

comment.author: 26105073@N03
comment._content:
San Francisco Bay Airdrome in Alameda, CA. I suspect this is the dedication on 08/16/1930. 
Just 11 years - 1941 - it ceased operation, perhaps due to WWII and nearby Alameda Naval Air Station.

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content:
Interesting it ceased operation due to WWII when so many companies and factories flourished due to the wars demand on American industry.

Great photo.

comment.author: 26105073@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27309380@N06] In further reading the reason given was because of the heavily increasing air traffic at NAS Alameda; they were "just next door", and increasing in size. And the military wanted their land for its use.

comment.author: 27309380@N06
comment._content: Interesting! Yeah, the Navy does require a lot of space! :-)
